nodes.bodyText: Was that actually triggering a lint issue?

Yup! It was getting assigned as a const on line 411 and then on line 418 the same identifier is declared as a type. It triggered off @typescript-eslint/no-redeclare. The other one in this file was DateRange which was declared as an interface, but there was an import for a Material UI Icon called DateRange in there too.
Okay, good to know. As it makes sense that you can do this, but I've always wondered what's the idiomatic approach. I'm happy to be guided by ESLint - they're a good egg. 😉
